title: How to Make Kashmiri Tea (Qahwah)

steps.headline: Crush the cardamom pods and cinnamon stick.
Put water in a pan / kettle, and start boiling.
Once the water starts boiling add sugar, saffron flakes, and the crushed cardamom pods & cinnamon stick.
Simmer / lower the heat and allow this concoction to boil, till it becomes thicker.
steps.description: The water should reduce to half.

steps.headline: Once it is thickened as required, turn off the heat.
Pour the liquid into a cup through a strainer.
A cup of the tempting Kashmiri Tea (Qahwah) is ready.
steps.description: Garnish with some saffron flakes and serve hot!

text: Crush the cardamom pods and cinnamon stick.  Put water in a pan / kettle, and start boiling.  Once the water starts boiling add sugar, saffron flakes, and the crushed cardamom pods & cinnamon stick.  Simmer / lower the heat and allow this concoction to boil, till it becomes thicker. The water should reduce to half. Once it is thickened as required, turn off the heat.  Pour the liquid into a cup through a strainer.  A cup of the tempting Kashmiri Tea (Qahwah) is ready. Garnish with some saffron flakes and serve hot!
